item.description:
Report E-2025030184

  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was operating a forklift when the forks of the lift punctured a container containing hazardous waste, liquid (Mercury <260 PPM). Less than 8 ounces of waste spilled from the container. The spill was contained and cleaned up by trained hazmat employees. The punctured container was overpacked.

item.title: Report E-2025030246
item.description:
Report E-2025030246

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-19
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 09:54 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal XTM. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Sherwin Williams Macropoxy 646 Part B released from four 5-gallon metal pales due to improper loading by previous terminal. The release impacted trailer #3159515. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. CHEMTREC has been notified of the spill, report #2025021900056 was given by Monica.

item.title: Report E-2025030169
item.description:
Report E-2025030169

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-11
  • City: NEENAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 11, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3266 was forked and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services. LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EX) to remediate the site. The crew utilized neutralizers, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the sire. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums and the damaged drum was overpacked in one (1) 95-gallon overpack.

item.title: Report E-2025030082
item.description:
Report E-2025030082

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-03
  • City: OSHKOSH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 33000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the trailer floor and walls and estimated that ten (10) gallons of material was released due to a load shift that damaged two (2) 5-gallon metal drums. Clean Harbors personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizer to the impacted areas and containerized the cleanup debris into six (6) 55-gallon metal drums. The impacted freight was properly cleaned and overpacked into eight (8) 85-gallon metal drums and reloaded onto the trailer. All generated waste was transported offsite for disposal.
